title: [BUG] Unable to fit SupervisedTimeSeriesForest
body:
**Describe the bug**

Unable to fit `SupervisedTimeSeriesForest` with X_train of shape (3900,1), y_train of shape (3900,). 

**To Reproduce**

```python
from sktime.classification.interval_based import SupervisedTimeSeriesForest
tsf = SupervisedTimeSeriesForest()
tsf.fit(X_train, y_train)
```
results in `ValueError: Found array with 0 feature(s) (shape=(3900, 0)) while a minimum of 1 is required.`
with `X_train.shape, y_train.shape` equal to  ((3900, 1), (3900,))


Note that this works well:
```python
from sktime.classification.interval_based import TimeSeriesForestClassifier
tsf = TimeSeriesForestClassifier()
tsf.fit(X_train, y_train)
```

**Expected behavior**

No error raised.

**Versions**
<details>
System:
    python: 3.9.7 (default, Sep 10 2021, 14:59:43)  [GCC 11.2.0]
executable: /bin/python3
   machine: Linux-5.13.0-40-generic-x86_64-with-glibc2.34

Python dependencies:
          pip: 22.0.3
   setuptools: 58.3.0
      sklearn: 1.0
       sktime: 0.11.3
  statsmodels: 0.13.2
        numpy: 1.21.3
        scipy: 1.5.2
       pandas: 1.3.4
   matplotlib: 3.4.3
       joblib: 1.1.0
        numba: 0.55.1
     pmdarima: None
      tsfresh: None
</details>

This problem drives me crazy.. Thanks for your help!
